H0.text: Hydroxide ions are the species whose concentration determines the strength of a base when it is dissolved in water.

H1.text: Combustion ions are the concentration that determines the strength of a base when it is dissolved in water.

H2.text: Calcium ions are the species whose concentration, when a base dissolves in water, determines the strength of the base.

H3.text: Monoxide ions are the species whose concentration determines the strength of a base when it is dissolved in water.

A4.text: The equilibrium constant Kb for the reaction of a base with water is given by Kb = [BH+][OHâˆ’]/[B].

A5.text: Strong bases hydrolyze in water almost completely, resulting in the release of hydroxide ions.
